page.title: 20Church road Methodist church
page.content: Methodism started in Weston in 1791. By 1847 a methodist church was opened.However this place was not large enough and so in 1879 the foundations were laid for a new church in church road.In 1883 a sunday school was opened and continued to meet for a number of years.in 1886 a special purpose built school room was opened. the sunday school was so popular that it needed more room. During 1940 the school room was used as a canteen for soldiers billeted in the area. In the past the church was kept open for people to use but now it is mainly locked.The reverend J.M.Bailey B.D is now running it.
